result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton U. Kampf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dalton U. Kampf is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dalton U. Kampf was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Dalton U. Kampf was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:26 PM Defendant Dalton U. Kampf not in court.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Keith Durand present in court - requesting the firearm given as a gift be returned to them. Still being held by ONSO - 
Sowinski statement- gun was actually used in the commision of crime and is considered contraband and do not have authority to return. 
Court statement.  Court recites law.  Court denies request to return firearm 
Mr. Durand statement
requesting return of evidence
Hearing on January 10, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Judge Bloom - do not expunge
terminated -regular

3:11 p.m. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to ordinance possession of drug paraphernalia - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Shawl/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Count 2
WHS/POP - 1 year
Fine - $300 plus costs totalling $831.00.
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/student
Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Count 3
Fine of $100 plus costs totalling $263.50

Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation, is not charged with any new crimes and pays all costs/fines/fees in full. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:32 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
No possession of any firearms; no possession of prescription drugs unless prescribed to defendant and taken in dosage/manner as prescribed.

3:24 p.m. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Shawl statement to waiver, motion hearing and negotiations for resolution.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State has no objections to bond modification. Court grants motion and modfies to $2500 signature and strikes no contact provision with Benjamin Moore. Bail continued. Adj. 3:29 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
to modify bail
and States Reply to Discovery

to appear and act

2:40 p.m. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:41 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

3:06 p.m. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not eligible for PD or court-appointed attorney. Court grants adjournment. Bail continued. Adj. 3:08 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:38 p.m. Court Commissioner John Hogan. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has attempted to seek counsel - is not eligible for PD - has petition for court appointed attorney. Defendant waives time limits - JA to advise defendant whether approval for petition for court appointed attorney- Court modifies bond that Defendant needs to contact JA by Friday to determine status of court appointed attorney. Bail continued. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of any firearms; no possession of prescription drugs unless prescribed to defendant and taken in dosage/manner as prescribed. No contact with Benjamin Moore.

2:04 p.m. Court Commissioner Galen Bayne-Allison. Defendant Dalton U. Kampf in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $500 cash bond. Defendant remanded until cash bond is posted. Adj. 2:13 p.m.  On record 2:15 p.m - Rebecca Durrand's father - statement to no contact provision with his daughter. Schiek - statement that no contact provision with Rebecca Durrand  is stricken - Granted. Defendant requests lower cash bond amount - denied. Adj. 2:16 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
